original: Josefson, Harry Fritiof August, komminister, Hyssna, f. 22/5/09 i Ta-num, Gbgs o. Boh. 1., av järnv:tj:- man Axel J. o. Ida Johansson. G. 37 m. Märtha Bergström. Barn: Margit f. 38, Brita 40, Inge 43. — Stud:ex. i Uddevalla 28, teol. fi-l. ex. 30, teol. kand. samt prakt. teol. prov 34, prästv. f. Gbgs stift 35. Varit past:adj. i öckerö, Skepplanda o. Tanum, v. kommin. i Grebbestad samt stiftsadj. i Gbgs stift (m. plac. i Sikagen, Danm., 0. tjg. bl. sv. fiskare i Danm., Norge, Engl. o. Skottl.), kyrkoadj. i Lysekil 42, kommin. i Hyssna sed. 42. Ordf. i HyS’Sna kyrkostämma, suppl. i Gbgs stifts diakoniråd.
translated: Josefson, Harry Fritiof August, chaplain, Hyssna, b. May 22, 1909 in Tanum, Gothenburg and Bohuslän 1., son of railway employee Axel J. and Ida Johansson. Married in 1937 to Märtha Bergström. Children: Margit b. 1938, Brita b. 1940, Inge b. 1943. He graduated from high school in Uddevalla in 1928, theological candidate in 1930, passed practical theological examination in 1934, and ordained as a minister in Gothenburg diocese in 1935. He has been a curate in Öckerö, Skepplanda, and Tanum, assistant vicar in Grebbestad, and assistant in Gothenburg diocese (with placement in Sikagen, Denmark, and serving as a chaplain to Swedish fishermen in Denmark, Norway, England, and Scotland), church assistant in Lysekil in 1942, and chaplain in Hyssna since 1942. He is the chairman of the Hyssna church meeting and a member of the Gothenburg diocese diaconal council.

structured.name: Harry Fritiof August Josefson
structured.description: Harry Fritiof August Josefson was a chaplain in Hyssna. He was born in Tanum, Gothenburg and Bohuslän on May 22, 1909, the son of railway employee Axel J. and Ida Johansson. He graduated from Uddevalla High School in 1928, became a theological candidate in 1930, passed the practical theological examination in 1934, and was ordained as a minister in the Gothenburg diocese in 1935. He served as a curate in Öckerö, Skepplanda, and Tanum, assistant vicar in Grebbestad, and assistant in Gothenburg diocese (with placement in Sikagen, Denmark), where he also served as the chaplain to Swedish fishermen in Denmark, Norway, England, and Scotland. He was a church assistant in Lysekil in 1942 and a chaplain in Hyssna from 1942 until his death. He was also the chairman of the Hyssna church meeting and a member of the Gothenburg diocese diaconal council.
